column4: I'm having trouble removing ubuntu-desktop from a server and replacing with Xubuntu
tried "sudo apt-get remove ubuntu-desktop"
and then "sudo apt-get autoremove" and it's still there
have a look at ubottu's message
I've just tried the bot response and followed the guide on the link given but the terminal keeps spitting back that some of the packages I'm trying to remove aren't there
can I add "-something" to just let it skip errors?
could you pastebin the exact error message ??
http://pastebin.com/2p3zab6H
it's just telling me that the packages aren't there I think...
and you're trying to remove those packages ?
I'm following this (where the bot told me to try) http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/purexfce
well if you get this message then this package is not installed, just skip it
is there not a way to --skip-broken or something when removing?
I don't think so
sorry - I may have made a n00b error and am following the walkthrough for 11.04 when I am on 10.04 - found another link and trying it now
ok
Pici thanks for the advice... the other line of code seems to be working
are you still there? I could do with a little more advice pls
I managed to uninstall ubuntu-desktop and have apparently install xubuntu-desktop too
but I am using freeNX to connect to the server which xubuntu should now be on and I don't get a DE like I did with Gnome - I get a single bg colour and nothing else
any ideas?
